text:
*PROBLEM WITH AMP*
Google recommandations for AMP tracking recommand to add a specific script inside the template
We really need to be able to add TAG Tracking on AMP Template
Thanks a lot :slightly_smiling_face:
does adding your google analytics id to the content settings generate this tag?
<@U8ZE2AMJ4>?
:eyes:
I think in the original version of hs forms there was an error message which positioned itself and had some built-in styles, and hsformerror was the class for that
That was a couple years ago
:wave:  Hey <@U2H3TT8F2> I’d like to help with the issue you are having here, Is the problem `.hsformerror` used to be and is no longer added to elements?
I believe it used to be on the form tag itself and then from there CSS was used to highlight inputs and error msg text
one of the themes our client is using has this override in there and I think since that was changed, it has no removed the formatting
Wow, O.K. I’ll check on this now for you
Thanks Glenn, appreciate it :slightly_smiling_face:

It looks like `.hsformerror` was a class used to display an error message outside of the form itself, not a class that was ever applied to the form element, it hasn’t been around for quite a long time
Is there a way to change the name of a user on the account in HS?
I am not seeing anything under the users section.
do you need to use the API to update the account user info?
for example, say we have an employee who is listed in our portal as a user and they get married or change their name legally, how would I change this to reflect that
ok. Thank you for checking on this.

make the man take the ladie’s name, solved. :laughing:

in all seriousness I thought the user themselves could edit their own name

Is there a changelog for the updates made to the platform? As I am trying to see if this was an oversight on the theme makers to not include a `invalid error` class in the CSS or if this is something we may have missed doing.

I believe you are correct. I think this should be something a super admin should be able to do though as I a sure we aren't the only ones who have uses/clients that would rather request we do it instead who can;t be bothered with it
<https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/articles/kcs_article/account/how-do-i-change-a-user-s-name>
Just have them give you the user account password and bam, easy peasy. :troll:
Is there anyway to prevent google from tracking CTA buttons that are linked to PDFs in FileManager, we are using CTA buttons on Gated content and the CTA links are showing up in Google Searches
the pages that have those CTAs do you have noindex nofollow on those pages?
that’s the only real reason they should be showing
Thank you pages should always have that
so the Thank you, is a pop-up on the current post page, not a separate page
ahh… yea that’s not going to work then
so I do not want a nofollow on the post page, just on the button that has the link
shouldn’t your your CTA be going to a landing page that then goes to a thank you page? seems like you’re going from CTA to file immediately skipping the 2 steps.
if you need to keep it the way you have it you could use javascript hypothetically to add a rel=nofollow
ok <@U7SL518D6>, I will have to see if that is feasible, thanks for the advice, so from your knowledge, there is no HubL code parameter to add to the {% cta %} to just do a no-follow
not that I’m aware of but would make sense for that to be a thing

Try adding it via JS (though i know there is a delay with CTA's loading so I am not sure how that will play into it):
<https://productforums.google.com/forum/#!topic/webmasters/EbHp0yjgT6c>
>>>You can do a Fetch as Google to test how Googlebot fetches and renders the page.

PS: it turns out that there is an old video about this from Matt Cutts, replying to a question from some guy called John Mueller.
<https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LW3pjQeCqqk>

At 43s, Matt specifically confirms that Googlebot looks at attributes such as nofollow.

Hey guys - question about content staging. Does the analytics get carried over when an existing page gets staged and then published back to the live site? I know I've already read it somewhere but couldn't remember exactly the answer
Yes, however there are situations that can screw up the analytics
for example if you stage a page, then publish to live then try to revert that publishing from staging to live - the staged page and old live page do not share stats anymore
Aha! Thanks for pointing that out <@U7SL518D6>

<@U7SL518D6> another quick question about the CTA button and nofollow, if I told my Marketing to put all their Gated PDFs/Docs in a specific folder on the File Manager, and then in the Robot.txt I used a wildcard to exclude the path, (i.e. <http://mydomain.com/hubfs/gated/*|mydomain.com/hubfs/gated/*>), do you think that would solve the Google result issue? Or do you think the CTA button path will still show up in the results
not an SEO expert but I’d guess that would work

Hey, all. Has anyone here developed a custom twitter feed on a HubSpot site that displays a set amount of recent tweets? If so, did you custom code it and tie in Twitter API, utilize a 3rd party plugin, or use some other method?
I did find this: <https://github.com/jasonmayes/Twitter-Post-Fetcher>, but was curious what options you guys may have used.
have you tried the recommended way to embed timelines? <https://publish.twitter.com/#>
They are pushing that way hard
There is a js library out there to style it your way, though
But only as good as long as they keep that structure
the old widgets were better
could customize them too
indeed
this is what i have used: `<https://github.com/kevinburke/customize-twitter-1.1>`

Struggling to create good lists for an Ecomm client based on ‘last purchased date’

Has anyone created a list based on x number of days since last deal?

It seems most list date options are fixed and not rolling? Is this the case?

how do I get a GTM code verified, when I put my custom module in my header at the top, and it still does not appear after <body>, there are still DIVs before it, is there instructions on how to verify a GTM tag, when I am usine a /home as my homepage

Chris,

There is a snippet you need in your <head> markup and some additional in your <body>.
(There’s a box for additional head markup)
well the one code needs to be in the head but then the noscript has to be immediately after the first body tag
<@UFC6BLEAV>, here is the instructions: Place the <noscript> portion of the Tag Manager code immediately after the opening <body> tag of your page. If you do not, verification will fail.
i cannot do that with that additional head markup, have u been able to verify your GTM before?
So I create a custom module for this and add to my page templates
yeah, ok so kinda strange I tried using a GTM trigger/tag to fire my UA analytics but that was not working, I have to add the UA code directly in the Settings
